column4: hey I am trying to set up a media server on an ubuntu box.  I want to control it remotely from another computer.  I have located the vnc server and all that, but what I want to do is control the computer without it sending an image of the monitor back because it takes up too much CPU
you can use ssh
you can also look into X11 forwarding over ssh if you absolutely need a GUI displayed locally for an application running on the remote server
yeah I'm messing with hulu so I need the gui
how do you do the X11 forwarding in that way?
enable X11 forwarding in the remove server's sshd config file and restart
then connect to the remote server using ssh -X
(this is assuming bboth machines are running X11)
I am a bit of a newbie.  where is the sshd and what do you need to put in it
but I dont understand why are you trying to view hulu streams from a remote machine on your local machine
my ubuntu box is hooked up to my TV
try logging into the remote machine via ssh, then launching your web browser with the hulu URL as an argument
I don't need to see the stream on my client computer, but the ubuntu box needs to show it
maybe the software "synergy" is all you need for what you're wanting
otherwise, just control the ubuntu machine via ssh like I suggested
what exactly does synergy do?
you can use your client workstation's mouse and keyboard on the remote ubuntu machine like it was just a separate display with its own operating system
you can drag your mouse over the ubuntu display and control it from your local computer
ardnew...aah...that should work
I'll play around with it.
thanks a lot
